column4: Uh, hi. I have been trying to get these drivers to work on Hardy for my 8600 GT and all it keeps doing for each driver is setting my max resolution to 640x480. Any suggestions?
same happened to me on my card strangely deleting conky and soft restart "as i call it" and running command gksudo displayconfig-gtk "if it doesnt run automacally" helps to set up the res
wow that seem's out there but I'm open for anything right about now.
im guessing im gonna have to guide you but because it worked for me may not work for you so be aware
Yea, a query would be nice, I'm running blind here, persay.

start by typing in terminal gksudo nautilus, go to /etc/X11/ folder and delete xorg.conf file and any other similar copies, afterwards do ctrl+alt+bckspc. This will send you into X basically command line wait a few secs and gdm or displayconfig will popup if not just login and type gksudo displayconfig-gtk and set your resolution under generic as well as motherboard "i had to do this twice but the second time instead of gksudo
before i forget just incase backup your current xorg.conf file doubt youll need it but just do so
I have a few backups of it saved, give me a minute and I will try this
It worked but I am driverless and Compiz turns me on. LOL

you shouldve set your board driver just run it again nto the whole thing just the displayconfig command and set that up, it should popup with a message to logout when youre done if it doesnt it didnt acknowledge request which is annoying
I didn't do the second part, all I did was delete the xorg.conf files.
That command 'gksudo displayconfig' didn't work, nothing appeared.
sorry thought you wrote it down from before its gksudo displayconfig-gtk that will work now
I got this after the command DOL gave me, and then you soon after....http://pastebin.com/d79d9fd08
please ask the question if anyone can help theyll help and i cnat help you with compiz or drivers for it
